clinical_study.brief_title: Perinatal Outcome After Premature Rupture of Membranes
clinical_study.official_title: Perinatal Outcomes According to Amniotic Fluid Indez After Premature Rupture of Membranes. A Prospective Cohort Study.

brief_summary.textblock: Premature rupture of membranes is an important cause of neonatal morbidity and mortality, mainly because of the complications associated with this pathology (oligohydramnios, cord compression or prolapse, infection). When rupture of the membranes occur the risk of cord compression increases but there is little evidence regarding this complication and amniotic fluid volume. The investigator's focus are the perinatal outcomes according to amniotic fluid volume (< 5 or >5).

primary_outcome.description: Number of cases in each cohort that were interrupted by cesarean section due to fetal distress (evidence of cord dystocia).

secondary_outcome.description: Number of perinatal deaths (ante, peri and postpartum until 28 days postpartum)in each cohort.
Number of cases of neonates diagnosed with sepsis in each cohort.

arm_group.description: Pregnant patients with gestations between 24-34 weeks with premature rupture of membranes that, when the decision was made to interrupt the pregnancy, had amniotic fluid volume index above 5.1
Pregnant patients with gestations between 24-34 weeks with premature rupture of membranes that, when the decision was made to interrupt the pregnancy, had amniotic fluid volume index of 5 or less.

study_pop.textblock: Pregnant patients between 24-34 weeks of gestation with a confirmed diagnosis of premature rupture of membranes.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Gestational age between 24-34 weeks.
- Confirmed diagnosis of premature rupture of membranes.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Twin pregnancies.
- Obstetric pathologies that require immediate termination of pregnancy (severe preeclampsia, abruptio placenta, cord prolapse).
- Termination of pregnancy (whatever the reason) before complete corticoid treatment.
- Incomplete recollection of all data required for analysis.
